channel.title: Where in my server?!

item.title: Where in my server?!
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_King I Am King
item.description:
@I_Am_King wrote:

You know i had this problem too and i still dont know. If you just want to get on your server to check it out i dont think you have to put it anywhere because lets say you downloaded Delta source and Delta client when you ran the source then opened the client it would use localhost and there is no need for a no-ip.

Read full topic

item.title: Where in my server?!
item.dc:creator: @scenemo scenemo
item.description:
@scenemo wrote:

im trying to get my client to connect to my server using my no-ip (PI client/source)
in my client/client.java i put the no-ip:

if((j == 13 || j == 10) && inputString.length() > 0) { if(myPrivilege >= 2 || server.equals("scenemoscape.no-ip.biz") || 1 == 1) { if(inputString.equals("region")) { System.out.println("Current region: " + anInt1069 + ", " + anInt1070); }
and in my source/server.java i dont know where to put because all i can find are ports e.g...
static { if(!Config.SERVER_DEBUG) { serverlistenerPort = 43594; } else { serverlistenerPort = 43594; }
&
System.out.println("Server listening on port 127.0.0.1:" + serverlistenerPort); /**
the system out print is just what shows up on the cmd prompt that runs and the serverlistening ports are just the ports... im not sure where im supposed to put my ip/no-ip o.O help plz? :/

Read full topic
